page.title: 10WILDLIFE IN ESKDALEMUIR
page.content: In 1970 the Economic Forestry Group set up a Wildlife Devolopement Project.This is seen, 15 years later to have controlled the vermin in the forest and to have greatly improved conditions for all the wildlife which colonise its area.The numbers of different bird species have increased from 35 to 85. Control of the sparrow crow by wildlife management has resulted in an increase of the owl, the predator which feeds on the vole an arch_enemy of trees and young plants nest sites of plover and curlew are now dound in Eskdalemuir. Two animals which kill almost anything are the min and the fox.The latter attacks sheep and lambs with disasterous results.Management of the deer population is an important factor in the protection of the forest.
